intro: Fagara densicrenata, commonly known as the dense-crenate fagara, is a species of flowering plant in the family Annonaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Mexico and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated margins and small, fragrant white flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. The fruit is a smooth, fleshy berry that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
